SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Familial pure gonadal dysgenesis with 46 XX karyotype and sensorineural deafness constitutes a rare autosomal recessive syndrome described initially by Perrault in 1951
The spectrum of the disease remains undetermined
Families with additional newer findings are regularly reported
CASE: We report two siblings with gonadal dysgenesis, progressive sensorineural deafness, Marfanoid body proportions and skeletal features, and a normal female karyotype
The diagnosis of Perrault syndrome was made
Abnormal body proportions including a longer arm span, shorter trunk, high arched palate, long slender fingers and positive thumb and wrist sign were observed
The siblings did not have any cardiac or ocular features of Marfan's syndrome
CONCLUSION: The report of the siblings adds to the expanding spectrum of findings in Perrault syndrome
